item.title: Nginx Security
item.description: 1. Turn On SELinux 2. Linux /etc/sysctl.conf Hardening Using sysctl, you can modify the kernel parameters without recompiling the kernel or rebooting the machine. # Avoid a smurf attack net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts = 1 # Turn on protection for bad icmp error messages net.ipv4.icmp_ignore_bogus_error_responses = 1 # Turn on syncookies for SYN flood attack protection net.ipv4.tcp_syncookies = 1 # Turn on and log spoofed, source routed, and redirect packets net.ipv4.conf.all.log_martians = 1 net.
